text: Does anybody know how to enable the download and print option in the quote creation ?As mentioned by the blog its default feature but now I dont have that so.(<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/deals/use-quotes>)

Print code: <https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/tryit.asp?filename=tryjsref_print|window.print(>);  
For download you can use this external library : <https://ekoopmans.github.io/html2pdf.js/>

Hey guys,
I am trying to add a total for an inline item, after the discount. Any suggestions?
I've tried doing it with JS and jQuery, however, I was not successful even after implementing a noConflinct function. Thanks in advance

Anyone seen this issue where the WYSIWYG menu disappears pretty much every second click while editing a post? I think it’s due to Z-index layering of a custom modules (header menu) messing with it.

Any easy way to disable modules in a template in the editor (hide them completely) or does that just have to be done with javascript and checking the URL?
Hmm actually it seems to be because the module that’s holding the “blog content” behind it is clickable. I wonder if overrideable=false would fix this issue
Hahaha now it works but that’s not ideal!
Weird, it goes away when you type something apparently lol. GOOD ENOUGH FOR ROCK N ROLL!
